sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An excellent ballad, entitul'd, The wandring Prince of Troy. To an excellent tune, call'd, Queen Dido, &c. Wandring Prince of Troy.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill.
printed by and for W.O. and sold by J. Walker, at the Hand and Pen in High Holbourn, London : [1700?]
Verse - "When Troy town for ten years wars,". Publication date estimated by Wing. First published [1660?] as: A proper new ballad, intituled, the wandring Prince of Troy. Cf. Wing P3668. In four columns with the title and woodcut above the first two; the columns are not separated by rules. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
=======
An excellent ballad, entitul'd, The wandring Prince of Troy. To an excellent tune, call'd, Queen Dido, &c. Wandring Prince of Troy.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill.
printed by and for W.O. and sold by J. Walker, at the Hand and Pen in High Holbourn, London : [1700?]
Verse - "When Troy town for ten years wars,". Publication date estimated by Wing. First published [1660?] as: A proper new ballad, intituled, the wandring Prince of Troy. Cf. Wing P3668. In four columns with the title and woodcut above the first two; the columns are not separated by rules. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
J. Walker
W.O.
High Holbourn
the Hand
